values.text: Kubernetes (K8s) is an open-source system for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications. [Get started](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tutorials/kubernetes-basics/)
Since you asked about kubernetes, are you interested in knowing how to get a cluster?
Knative Eventing is a system that is designed to address a common need for cloud native development and provides composable primitives to enable late-binding event sources and event consumers.
Since you are interested in knative eventing, you would  you like to know what is knative serving?

A deploy script runs on your terminal which carries out following tasks:
1. asks user if they want to replace default values in Secrets or ConfigMap resource manifests.
2. adds user specified values to Kubernetes resource manifests
3. applies resource manifests to Kubernetes cluster

generic.title: Hi! I am Scout. I can help you with

values.text:
To deploy serverless apps, we need clusters with Knative installed in them.
1. To create cluster on openshift visit [try.openshift.com] (https://try.openshift.com/) and to install knative follow [knative-with-openshift](https://knative.dev/docs/install/knative-with-openshift/)
2. To create cluster on kubernetes visit [kubernetes.io] (https://kubernetes.io/docs/setup/) and to install knative follow [knative-install](https://knative.dev/docs/install/)
Okay! Action aborted
Red Hat OpenShift is a leading hybrid cloud, enterprise Kubernetes application platform [Get started](https://try.openshift.com/)
Since you asked about openshift, you may be interested in knowing how to get a cluster.

You can deploy your app with few easy steps.
1. kscout requires you to have access to knative installed cluster to deploy.
2. Search for an app you want to deploy
3. Click the deploy button on website / chat interface.
4. Log in to your cluster namespace
5. Run the given command on the terminal.
Do you want to know how to create a cluster?

Knative Serving builds on Kubernetes and Istio to support deploying and serving of serverless applications and functions. Serving is easy to get started with and scales to support advanced scenarios. [Read more](https://knative.dev/docs/serving/)

<? (returning_from_digression)? "Let's get back to where we left off.
What app do you want to search?" : "Can you describe the app?" ?>

1. You can contribute to kscout by uploading your serverless app to the hub, thus helping other users who are trying to solve similar problems.
2. You can also track development of kscout.io hub on [Github](https://github.com/kscout/)
Since you asked about contributing to kscout, do you want to know how to submit an app?

Serverless architectures are application designs that incorporate third-party service, known as Backend-as- a-service or include custom code run in managed, ephemeral containers, known as Function-as-a-service. Read more: [serverless](https://martinfowler.com/articles/serverless.html )

Knative provides fundamental building blocks for serverless workloads in Kubernetes, empowering the creation of modern, container-based and cloud-native applications which can be deployed anywhere on Kubernetes
[https://knative.dev/](https://knative.dev/)
Happy to help later

Kubernetes secret objects let you store and manage sensitive information, such as passwords, OAuth tokens, and ssh keys. Putting this information in a secret is safer and more flexible than putting it verbatim in a Pod definition or in a container image . [Read more](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/secret/)
<? (returning_from_digression)? "What do you want to learn?" : "What do you want to learn?" ?>
I am sorry. Let me know how can I help you

generic.title: I can help you with following queries

input.text: How do I contribute to kscout?

options.label: How to upload an app to hub?
What happens when I deploy an app?
How do I create a cluster?

input.text: How do I create a cluster?

values.text:
Follow the steps below to upload an app :
1. Create a serverless app.
2. Clone repo [serverless-apps] (https://github.com/kscout/serverless-apps).
3.Follow the steps in the [README](https://github.com/kscout/serverless-apps/blob/master/README.md) file
5. Create a PR with all the changes
4. A member of the team will review your pull request and add your application in no time.

AWS Lambda lets you run your code without provisioning or managing servers.  It is a serverless computing service provided by Amazon Web Services. [Learn more](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lambda/latest/dg/welcome.html)
Knative Hackathon information coming soon !!
<? (returning_from_digression)? "May I help you with anything else?" : "Hmm, I did not understand. Can you please rephrase?" ?>

KScout.io is a Smart Hub for Knative Serverless Apps.
You can use this site to learn about serverless and knative architecture, explore example serverless apps developed by community contributors, and deploy them to your own clusters.
All apps on the site are open source, build off them, contribute back to them, use them to see the power and flexibility of serverless architecture.
Glad I could be of help
Which cluster do you have?
Hi!. I am Scout
